title: What is the oldest known Italian dish? - Quora

response.answer_text: I would say Roast Boar - 4th-5th Century AD If you are looking for a sweet dish - The Linzer Torte - a tart with jam and a lattice pastry top. Its reputation as the most ancient of the cake recipes is down to the fact that its lineage has been traced back further than any other. It shows up not only in a 1696 recipe, but in a veronese manuscript dated back to 1653  7 Of The Oldest Recipes In History
